授業目的:
The aim of this course is to continue to build on students' intensive and extensive reading skills by reading about a variety of current events and policy topics. Students will use graded readers to improve their reading fluency and vocabulary, and improve their critical reading skills.
＜Seminar＞ The purpose of this course is to develop students' academic discussion skills focusing on social issues.
到達目標:
Students will be able to: 1) increase their ability to comprehend academic and current events-related texts 2) expand their knowledge of vocabulary 3) improve their reading speed and fluency and 4) strengthen their critical, analytical reading skills.
Students learn vocabulary, how to use discussion questions, and discussion skills. Students also learn how to evaluate information on the web.
特記事項: 本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。 The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法: <all> Materials, instruction, and all class communication are in English. Course materials will be available to students through LUNA.

*All 14 classes will be conducted face-to-face.
Students complete intensive and extensive reading tasks. This includes responding to and discussing their reading.
Students will develop an ability to discuss a topic with a group. The topics will challenge students to think beyond their experiences and cultural influences.

備考　Note
Students will be assessed on presentations made in class, the visual support and written planning and reflection tasks.
＜Reading＞Students will be assessed based on quizzes, unit discussions, extensive reading, participation, and literature circle performance.
＜Seminar＞Students are assessed on this course through unit discussion tests, test preparation materials, and article-related discussion preparation materials.
＜Writing＞ Students are assessed on the the drafts of essays they write, quizzes, in-class writing activities.
